column1: Section 10 of the Evidence Ordinance, which referrers to things said or done by
a conspirator in reference to the common intention reads thus: -

Where  there 
is  reasonable  ground  to  believe  that  two  or  more

persons  have  conspired 
together 
to  commit  an  offence  or  an
actionable wrong, anything said done, or written by any one of such
persons  in  reference  to  their  common  intention,  after  the  time
when such intention was first entertained by any one of them, is a

relevant 
fact  as  against  each  of  the  persons  believed  to  be  so
